annotation.spannedText: you won't get sick if you're exposed to them later

classMention.mentionClass: you won't get sick if you're exposed to them later

annotation.spannedText: Today, more people living with HIV than ever before have access to life-saving treatment with HIV medicines (called antiretroviral therapy or ART), which is good for their health and reduces the likelihood that they will transmit the virus to others if they adhere to their HIV medication

classMention.mentionClass: Today, more people living with HIV than ever before have access to life-saving treatment with HIV medicines (called antiretroviral therapy or ART), which is good for their health and reduces the likelihood that they will transmit the virus to others if they adhere to their HIV medication

annotation.spannedText: we need a powerful array of HIV prevention tools that are widely accessible to all who would benefit from them

classMention.mentionClass: we need a powerful array of HIV prevention tools that are widely accessible to all who would benefit from them

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines historically have been the most effective means to prevent and even eradicate infectious diseases

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines historically have been the most effective means to prevent and even eradicate infectious diseases

annotation.spannedText: They safely and cost-effectively prevent illness, disability, and death

classMention.mentionClass: They safely and cost-effectively prevent illness, disability, and death

annotation.spannedText: Like smallpox and polio vaccines, a preventive HIV vaccine could help save millions of lives

classMention.mentionClass: Like smallpox and polio vaccines, a preventive HIV vaccine could help save millions of lives

annotation.spannedText: Developing safe, effective, and affordable vaccines that can prevent HIV infection in uninfected people is the best hope for controlling and ultimately ending the HIV/AIDS pandemic

classMention.mentionClass: Developing safe, effective, and affordable vaccines that can prevent HIV infection in uninfected people is the best hope for controlling and ultimately ending the HIV/AIDS pandemic

annotation.spannedText: A partially effective vaccine could decrease the number of people who get infected with HIV, further reducing the number of people who can pass the virus on to others

classMention.mentionClass: A partially effective vaccine could decrease the number of people who get infected with HIV, further reducing the number of people who can pass the virus on to others

annotation.spannedText: A therapeutic vaccine could also benefit people living with HIV by helping slow the progression of the disease and preventing or delaying the onset of AIDS

classMention.mentionClass: A therapeutic vaccine could also benefit people living with HIV by helping slow the progression of the disease and preventing or delaying the onset of AIDS
